title.narrative: 1.3. CP REFERRAL SYSTEM

description.narrative: Mechanisms established at national and subnational levels to identify, refer, report and intervene to protect children from violations of their rights, which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children, especially the most deprived, access and utilize quality and equitable protection, education, health and nutrition services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Mechanisms established at national and subnational levels to identify, refer, report and intervene to protect children fromviolations of their rights

description.narrative: Child protection referral networks and coordination mechanisms with multi-sectoral participation were functioning in the three pilot districts. An Electronic Case Management system was used in pilot districts, and as of December 2020, 1,375 case files were assembled in the system. The system will be adapted to the Social Services Agency of the MoLSPP in early 2021. | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/01/2021

title.narrative: Electronic case-management system established and tested(42470)

actual.value: 2020:Electronic case management system is used in pilot districts and as of December 2020, 1375 case files were included in the system.
